# Toast Component Usage Guide

## Overview

The Toast component provides a comprehensive notification system with flexible positioning, multiple variants, and customizable properties. It uses a context-based approach with a provider pattern for global toast management.

## Features

- **Multiple Variants**: Success, Error, Warning, Info, Danger
- **Flexible Positioning**: 6 position options (top/bottom + left/center/right)
- **Responsive Sizing**: 5 size options (xs, sm, md, lg, xl)
- **Auto Dismiss**: Configurable auto-dismiss with custom delay
- **Customizable Content**: Optional title, description, icon, and close button
- **Theme Support**: Full light/dark mode compatibility
- **Accessibility**: ARIA labels and proper semantic markup

## Basic Usage

### 1. Setup ToastProvider

Wrap your application with the ToastProvider:

```tsx
import { ToastProvider } from './components/Toast';

function App() {
  return (
    <ToastProvider defaultPosition="top-right">
      <YourApp />
    </ToastProvider>
  );
}
```

### 2. Use Toast Hook

Use the `useToast` hook to show toasts:

```tsx
import { useToast } from './components/Toast';

function MyComponent() {
  const { showToast } = useToast();

  const handleSuccess = () => {
    showToast({
      title: 'Success!',
      description: 'Your action was completed successfully.',
      variant: 'success'
    });
  };

  return (
    <button onClick={handleSuccess}>
      Show Success Toast
    </button>
  );
}
```

## ToastProvider Props

| Prop | Type | Default | Description |
|------|------|---------|-------------|
| `defaultPosition` | `ToastPosition` | `'top-right'` | Default position for all toasts |
| `defaultSize` | `ToastSize` | `'md'` | Default size for all toasts |
| `autoDismissDelay` | `number` | `5000` | Auto dismiss delay in milliseconds |
| `hasAutoDismiss` | `boolean` | `true` | Enable/disable auto dismiss |
| `hasIcon` | `boolean` | `true` | Show/hide icons in toasts |
| `hasCloseButton` | `boolean` | `true` | Show/hide close buttons |
| `hasTitle` | `boolean` | `true` | Show/hide titles |
| `hasDescription` | `boolean` | `true` | Show/hide descriptions |
| `customColor` | `string` | `undefined` | Custom background color |

## Toast Variants

### Success
```tsx
showToast({
  title: 'Success!',
  description: 'Your action was completed successfully.',
  variant: 'success'
});
```

### Error
```tsx
showToast({
  title: 'Error!',
  description: 'Something went wrong. Please try again.',
  variant: 'error'
});
```

### Warning
```tsx
showToast({
  title: 'Warning!',
  description: 'Please be careful with this action.',
  variant: 'warning'
});
```

### Info
```tsx
showToast({
  title: 'Information',
  description: 'Here is some useful information for you.',
  variant: 'info'
});
```

### Danger
```tsx
showToast({
  title: 'Danger!',
  description: 'This action cannot be undone.',
  variant: 'danger'
});
```

## Positioning

The Toast component supports 6 different positions:

### Top Positions
- `top-left`: Top left corner
- `top-center`: Centered at top
- `top-right`: Top right corner

### Bottom Positions
- `bottom-left`: Bottom left corner
- `bottom-center`: Centered at bottom
- `bottom-right`: Bottom right corner

### Dynamic Position Updates

You can update the position dynamically using the `updatePosition` function:

```tsx
import { useToast } from './components/Toast';

function MyComponent() {
  const { updatePosition } = useToast();

  const changePosition = (newPosition) => {
    updatePosition(newPosition);
  };

  return (
    <select onChange={(e) => changePosition(e.target.value)}>
      <option value="top-left">Top Left</option>
      <option value="top-center">Top Center</option>
      <option value="top-right">Top Right</option>
      <option value="bottom-left">Bottom Left</option>
      <option value="bottom-center">Bottom Center</option>
      <option value="bottom-right">Bottom Right</option>
    </select>
  );
}
```

## Sizing

The Toast component supports 5 different sizes:

```tsx
showToast({
  title: 'Small Toast',
  variant: 'info',
  size: 'sm' // xs, sm, md, lg, xl
});
```

| Size | Padding | Text Size | Min Width | Max Width |
|------|---------|-----------|-----------|-----------|
| `xs` | `p-2` | `text-xs` | `min-w-64` | `max-w-sm` |
| `sm` | `p-3` | `text-sm` | `min-w-72` | `max-w-sm` |
| `md` | `p-4` | `text-base` | `min-w-80` | `max-w-sm` |
| `lg` | `p-5` | `text-lg` | `min-w-96` | `max-w-sm` |
| `xl` | `p-6` | `text-xl` | `min-w-[28rem]` | `max-w-sm` |

## Customization

### Custom Colors

You can override the default variant colors:

```tsx
<ToastProvider customColor="#ff6b6b">
  <YourApp />
</ToastProvider>
```

### Disable Auto Dismiss

```tsx
<ToastProvider hasAutoDismiss={false}>
  <YourApp />
</ToastProvider>
```

### Custom Dismiss Delay

```tsx
<ToastProvider autoDismissDelay={10000}>
  <YourApp />
</ToastProvider>
```

### Hide Elements

```tsx
<ToastProvider 
  hasIcon={false}
  hasCloseButton={false}
  hasTitle={false}
  hasDescription={false}
>
  <YourApp />
</ToastProvider>
```

## Advanced Usage

### Multiple Toast Instances

The ToastProvider automatically manages multiple toasts:

```tsx
function MyComponent() {
  const { showToast } = useToast();

  const showMultipleToasts = () => {
    showToast({ title: 'First Toast', variant: 'success' });
    setTimeout(() => {
      showToast({ title: 'Second Toast', variant: 'info' });
    }, 1000);
    setTimeout(() => {
      showToast({ title: 'Third Toast', variant: 'warning' });
    }, 2000);
  };

  return <button onClick={showMultipleToasts}>Show Multiple Toasts</button>;
}
```

### Toast with Custom Size

```tsx
showToast({
  title: 'Large Toast',
  description: 'This is a large toast notification.',
  variant: 'success',
  size: 'lg'
});
```

## Accessibility

The Toast component includes proper accessibility features:

- **ARIA Labels**: `role="status"` and `aria-live="polite"`
- **Keyboard Navigation**: Close button is keyboard accessible
- **Screen Reader Support**: Proper semantic markup
- **Focus Management**: Automatic focus handling

## Testing

Use the interactive ToastTestPage to test all features:

```bash
# Access the test page
http://localhost:5173/toast-test.html
```

The test page includes:
- Interactive controls for all properties
- Real-time preview
- Code generation
- Position testing
- Variant testing

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

1. **Toasts not appearing**: Ensure ToastProvider wraps your app
2. **Position not updating**: Use `updatePosition` function from `useToast` hook
3. **Styling conflicts**: Toast styles are self-contained and shouldn't conflict
4. **Multiple toasts**: Each toast gets a unique ID automatically

### Debug Mode

Enable debug logging by checking browser console for position updates:

```tsx
// Debug logs will show:
// "ToastDemo: Updating position to top-center"
// "ToastProvider: Updating position to top-center"
```

## Migration Guide

### From v1.0.67 to v1.0.68+

The Toast component has been significantly improved:

1. **New Flexbox Positioning**: More reliable positioning system
2. **Better Center Alignment**: Fixed center positioning issues
3. **Improved Communication**: Better position update handling
4. **Enhanced Test Page**: Comprehensive interactive testing

No breaking changes - existing implementations will continue to work.

## Best Practices

1. **Use Appropriate Variants**: Choose the right variant for the message type
2. **Keep Messages Concise**: Short, clear messages work best
3. **Provide Context**: Include descriptions for complex actions
4. **Test Positioning**: Verify positioning works on different screen sizes
5. **Consider Auto Dismiss**: Use appropriate dismiss delays for different message types

## Examples

### Complete Example

```tsx
import React from 'react';
import { ToastProvider, useToast } from './components/Toast';

function App() {
  return (
    <ToastProvider 
      defaultPosition="top-right"
      defaultSize="md"
      autoDismissDelay={5000}
      hasAutoDismiss={true}
    >
      <MyApp />
    </ToastProvider>
  );
}

function MyApp() {
  const { showToast, updatePosition } = useToast();

  return (
    <div>
      <button onClick={() => showToast({
        title: 'Success!',
        description: 'Operation completed successfully.',
        variant: 'success'
      })}>
        Show Success Toast
      </button>
      
      <button onClick={() => updatePosition('bottom-center')}>
        Move to Bottom Center
      </button>
    </div>
  );
}
```

This comprehensive guide covers all aspects of the Toast component, from basic usage to advanced customization and troubleshooting.
